content:
I cannot predict the future, but the tourism industry faces significant challenges with many businesses struggling to survive given the pandemic's impact. 

while the government measures to encourage domestic travel are helpful, they may not be enough to save all of the local businesses that have been impacted. some businesses have already closed, and some may not recover even with government support.

therefore, it will be essential for governments, the private sector, and individuals to work together to support local tourism businesses to mitigate the impact of the pandemic. this may include encouraging people to travel domestically, implementing effective safety measures that provide reassurance to travelers, and promoting more sustainable tourism practices.

ultimately, the recovery of local businesses will depend on factors such as the duration and severity of the pandemic, the level of government support, and the willingness of people to travel.
